The <Picture> component

Location: /src/components/picture.js

Image optimization

Please read the image optimization docs before using the <Picture> component!

Corgi's built-in <Picture> component allows you to easily use the generated and optimized images from its image optimization step. This component renders a standard HTML <picture> element; with fallback formats, 1x and 2x srcset support, and breakpoint-specific images.

In this article:

  • Basic usage
  • Breakpoint-spacific images
  • Props

Basic usage​

Given the source file location of /src/images/defined/logo-2x.png, we can use the component as shown below.

There are two things to take note of here:

  • The src attribute does not expect the -2x suffix in the filename.
  • The inclusion of the webp prop set to true — this is optional, but can be useful for serving up highly-optimized images for modern browsers.
<Picture> component usage
import Picture from "../picture";

const MyComponent = () => (
  <Picture src="/logo.png" alt="Description of the company logo." webp={true} />
);
Rendered DOM markup
<picture>
  <source
    srcset="/_images/logo.webp 1x, /_images/logo-2x.webp 2x"
    type="image/webp"
  />
  <source
    srcset="/_images/logo.png 1x, /_images/logo-2x.png 2x"
    type="image/png"
  />
  <img
    class=""
    alt="Description of the company logo."
    src="/_images/logo.png"
  />
</picture>

Images for different breakpoints​

Providing your source files with specific breakpoint suffixes will generate and optimize all the necessary breakpoint-specific versions of your image. The best part? You do not have to change anything about how you use the component—it's all automatic, based on the filenames. The breakpoint suffixes are as follows, and match those of Corgi's defined CSS breakpoints:

Available breakpoint suffixes
medium-up
large-up
xlarge-up
xxlarge-up
File tree with breakpoint-specific images
.
└── public/
    └── _images/
        ├── logo-2x.png
        ├── logo-medium-up-2x.png
        └── logo-large-up-2x.png
Rendered DOM markup
<picture>
  <source
    media="(min-width: 1024px)"
    srcset="/_images/logo-large-up.webp 1x, /_images/logo-large-up-2x.webp 2x"
    width="248"
    height="128"
    type="image/webp"
  />
  <source
    media="(min-width: 1024px)"
    srcset="/_images/logo-large-up.png 1x, /_images/logo-large-up-2x.png 2x"
    width="248"
    height="128"
    type="image/png"
  />
  <source
    media="(min-width: 640px)"
    srcset="/_images/logo-medium-up.webp 1x, /_images/logo-medium-up-2x.webp 2x"
    width="248"
    height="128"
    type="image/webp"
  />
  <source
    media="(min-width: 640px)"
    srcset="/_images/logo-medium-up.png 1x, /_images/logo-medium-up-2x.png 2x"
    width="248"
    height="128"
    type="image/png"
  />
  <source
    srcset="/_images/logo.webp 1x, /_images/logo-2x.webp 2x"
    type="image/webp"
    width="248"
    height="128"
  />
  <source
    srcset="/_images/logo.png 1x, /_images/logo-2x.png 2x"
    type="image/png"
    width="248"
    height="128"
  />
  <img
    class=""
    alt="Description of the company logo."
    src="/_images/logo.png"
  />
</picture>

As you can see, this is component is invaluable for working with images!

Props​

PropTypeDescription
srcStringThe path to an image, starting from the /src/images/defined/ directory and including a leading slash. This should not include the -2x prefix.
altStringAlt text attribute for the image.
webpBooleanOptional. Whether to render <source> tags for the webp format. Applies to .png source files only. Default: false.
breakpointsArrayOptional. Array of breakpoint strings, used for overwriting the default filename-based output. Can include any of: "medium-up", "large-up", "xlarge-up", "xxlarge-up".
lazyBooleanOptional. Whether to add browser-native lazy-loading, via the loading="lazy" attribute. Default: false.
classNameStringOptional. CSS className to be appended to the rendered <img> element.
pictureClassNameStringOptional. CSS className to be appended to the rendered <picture> element.
